author: David Gauthier-Villars
title: In Cross-Country Skiing, Not Fast, Not Furious
text:
PYEONGCHANG, South Korea—When he watches the men’s 50-kilometer cross-country race at the Olympic Games here on Saturday, Pierre Mignerey won’t just be interested in the winner’s name. He will also pay close attention to how he skied.
As the race director for cross-country at the International Ski Federation, Mignerey is in charge of implementing rules the governing body adopted two years ago to safeguard what he calls “le beau ski,” or beautiful skiing.
...
